metadata.synopsis: Zenovia Dawg, leader of the Rivington Rats, approaches the player after the refugee conflict at the merchant's house has been resolved - she doesn't take kindly to anyone interfering in her (or the Guild's) business.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Zenovia approaches you automatically after the main merchant's house refugee conflict dialogue is resolved.BGO_Main_Agoto 14; 50; -93proceed through the Conflict dialog. Do either of these:persuade to chase out the refugees for half-price or for freeintimidate Arfur to let them staydialog with Zenovia should start automatically after that

8.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
8.text: Do you think you're clever coming in and undercutting us, sweetheart?

26.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
26.text: We were about to make a bit of extra cash before you butted in - you owe the Guild a cut.

68.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
68.text: Is the little dog trying to intimidate us? If it continues to bark, I will snap its neck.

94.speaker: Narrator
94.text: *The Guild: a loose coalition uniting every criminal outfit in the city under one collective rule, from cutpurses to contract killers.*

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I had a look in your employer's basement - did you know he puts explosives in children's toys?

63.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
63.text: And I'm the Duke's personal bed warmer. I don't care what pies he's got his grimy little fingers in - just give me the gold.
63.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic/starting to lose her patience ever so slightly

149.speaker: Player
149.text: How much gold are we talking?

121.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
121.text: Just a little something - consider it a gesture of good will. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
121.context: NodeContext: Almost warm - maybe the player is going to appease her

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I'll pay you, but I need some time to get the gold together.

87.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
87.text: You think I'm just a pretty face? You'll pay up now - and just for trying it on, you can pay me double.
87.context: NodeContext: Slightly playful - but most definitely a threat

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I'm not paying you that much - that's pure extortion.

61.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
61.text: You know, it's shocking how many people opt for the hard way when the easy way's right there. Any last words?
61.context: NodeContext: Weary; was hoping this would be easier

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Do you think I was born yesterday? That's nowhere near Guild rates - half it and we'll call it a deal.

69.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
69.text: Sharp little creature, aren't you? All right then - half.

6.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
6.context: NodeContext: Patronising - like telling a dog it's been good

80.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
80.text: Well, boys - we did what we were paid for. Let's leave this lot to their misery.
80.context: NodeContext: Almost sighing; it's been a long day

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Works for me. And, as we're all friends now, maybe I could get some Guild assistance of my own at some point?

79.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
79.text: Smooth talker, aren't you? What did you have in mind?

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Can you get me into the city proper?

78.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
78.text: Not my personal area of expertise - but Nine-Fingers'll know how.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: I could do with a blade like yours - you ready for your next job?

30.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
30.text: How presumptuous - it's almost endearin'. That'd be up to Nine-Fingers to decide.

56.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
56.text: She's at the Guildhall in the Lower City - you can't miss her.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: I want to meet your boss.

51.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
51.context: NodeContext: Amused and almost a little impressed at the audacity of the request

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Nothing for now - I just wanted to make sure it was an option.

62.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
62.text: It certainly could be - I'll be sure to let Nine-Fingers know you're interested in collaboratin'.
62.context: NodeContext: Mildly amused at the proposition

11.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
11.text: Sweet of you to ask, but I don't think you can afford me.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Actually I've changed my mind - no deal.

84.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
84.text: You know, this was fun to begin with but now I'm getting bored.

113.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
113.text: Boys - how about a bit of the Rivington Rats' famous hospitality for our friend here?

55.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
55.text: As far as you're concerned, I am the Guild. And you know what? The price has just doubled. What a shame.

148.speaker: Player
148.text: Knock some sense into this upstart.

46.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player swings at Zenovia and punches her (punch can be cut around to avoid showing actual contact)

9.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
9.text: That... was a mistake on your part, sweetie. A mistake the Guild will hear about.

29.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
29.text: Come on, boys - we've got places to be.
29.context: InternalNodeContext: To the Rivington RatsNodeContext: Stiffly; trying to save face

86.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player swings at Zenovia - who dodges out of the way and punches the player in return (punch can be cut around to avoid showing actual contact)

83.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
83.text: You're a clumsy little kitten, aren't you? Adorable.

58.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
58.text: I'll almost feel sorry grinding you into the dirt.
58.context: NodeContext: Amused; she definitely does not feel sorry for the player

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I'm not giving you a single gold piece.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Whatever you've been paid isn't worth dying to me - I know how to make it hurt.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I've always been a difficult person - I just can't help it.

98.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
98.text: You know, somehow I can believe that.
98.context: NodeContext: Mild amusement - but she's still going to kill the player anyway

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Then you're as much of a monster as he is.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: You can deal with those refugees yourself if you really want - I'm not invested.

2.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
2.text: Ah, but thanks to your little interference with our business, you are invested.

41.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
41.text: And we can't have our mutual friend Arfur thinking he outsmarted us.
41.context: NodeContext: Almost laughing through her quiet anger

23.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
23.text: Give me what you owe or maybe I'll just have to help myself to it when you're dead.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Suppose I agree - what is this cut exactly?

16.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
16.text: I see you're a charitable sort - perhaps you have some benevolence to spare for us poor souls?

146.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
146.text: We just lost a load of gold thanks to somebody interfering in our business, you see, and now we're a little out of pocket.
146.context: NodeContext: Mock ignorance - and clearly slightly annoyed

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Real shame, that - but you'll have to find your charitable donation elsewhere.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I fought and killed an avatar of Myrkul recently. Do you have any last words?

100.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
100.text: You're... serious. Let's forget this unpleasantness ever happened.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: I am the child of Lord Bhaal, this filthy city's eternal terror. Do you have any last words?

130.speaker: Player
130.text: Calm down - how much are you after exactly?

140.speaker: Player
140.text: I could give you that gold - but then I'd just take it back after I killed you.

126.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
126.text: I think you're overestimating your abilities somewhat - but I haven't got time for this.
126.context: NodeContext: Trying to save face after successfully being intimidated; trying to pretend she's just too busy to deal with this and not afraid at the bloody threat

135.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
135.text: You took the words right out of my mouth.
135.context: NodeContext: Relishing the imminent fight; she's glad to be able to kill the player (or try)

102.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
102.text: You think you can just waltz in here and meddle with our livelihood?

138.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
138.text: I respect your hustle, sweetheart, but it won't work on me.

36.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
36.text: You've stepped on the Guild's toes - and we'd like a little something to make it better.

25.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
25.text: I'd say 'you'll live to regret it' but honestly I'm not so sure you'd live.
25.context: NodeContext: Clearly confident in her ability to kill the player

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I am the child of Lord Bhaal, this filthy city's eternal terror. Do you have any last words?

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I fought and killed an avatar of Myrkul recently. I think I can handle you.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: All right, I get it - how much do you want?
